definition: discontent/complaint/to complain
firm/sturdy/fold (for animals)/sacrifice/prison
trouble/disturbance/rumpus/flirty/coquettish/abbr. for 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]/literary writings/smell of urine/foul smell/male (animal) (dialect)
to whine/to be grouchy
lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining

sentences.english: We closed our ears to their complaints.
sentences.chinese: 我們不理睬他們的牢騷。

sentences.english: Her long hair is often plained.
But what if you’re feeling grouchy?
sentences.chinese: 如果你自己都滿腹牢騷情況會怎麼樣呢？

sentences.english: This is the third time the tourists squawked about the service of the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 這是旅客們第三次對飯店的服務發牢騷了。

sentences.english: He is forever croaking about his problems .
sentences.chinese: 他老是爲他那些問題發牢騷。

sentences.english: Her incessant whining drives me crazy.
Could you go without griping about anything for a day?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能一整天都不發一句牢騷？

sentences.english: Do you have the time, To listen to me whine.
sentences.chinese: 你有時間，來聽我發牢騷嗎。

sentences.english: You don’t like it here, don’t fuck so much next time.
sentences.chinese: 如果不喜歡這裏，就別他媽的在這裏發牢騷。

sentences.english: Go on, go on, ILove to hear you whine.
sentences.chinese: 繼續說啊，我喜歡聽你發牢騷。

sentences.english: I’m really bored with his sitting there doing nothing but beefing.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在那裏什麼事也不幹，總是發牢騷，真煩死人。

sentences.english: For my dream i will grin and bear it, without complaint.
sentences.chinese: 爲了這個夢想我要任勞任怨不再滿腹牢騷。

sentences.english: I wish he'd stop belly-aching about his children's behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再爲孩子們的行爲發牢騷了。

sentences.english: Just under one third said grousing was intheFrench temperament.
sentences.chinese: 近三分之一的人說法國人愛發牢騷是性情使然。

sentences.english: Is it me or does Dave Winer just whine too much?
sentences.chinese: 是我還是大衛維特牢騷太多？

definition: to whine/to be grouchy
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
(say) a few words
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
to consider/to ponder
to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to express (an emotion)/to give vent
(Tw) from time to time/frequently
to prattle/to chatter away/to nag/garrulous/nagging
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
internal injury/disorder of internal organs (due to improper nutrition, overexertion etc)
